articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.author: Stephanie  Watson
articles.title: Is It a Cold, the Flu, Allergies, or COVID-19? - WebMD
articles.description: Respiratory illnesses can share  so many of the same symptoms -- a fever, chills, coughing, tiredness, a sore throat, body aches, a headache, and a stuffed nose -- so it's not easy to tell the difference.
articles.content: Nov. 2, 2020 -- In the past, a cough or sore throat would have been a pretty obvious sign that you'd caught a cold or the flu. During this year's cold and flu season, you also have to wonder whether … [+1565 chars]

articles.title: Vitamin D levels during pregnancy linked with child IQ - Science Daily
articles.description: A study showed that mothers' vitamin D levels during pregnancy were associated with their children's IQ, suggesting that higher vitamin D levels in pregnancy may lead to greater childhood IQ scores.
articles.content: Vitamin D is a critical nutrient and has many important functions in the body. A mother's vitamin D supply is passed to her baby in utero and helps regulate processes including brain development. A s… [+4631 chars]

articles.title: People who have Covid-19 or who have been exposed can vote in person, CDC says - msnNOW
articles.description: Can you vote in person if you are currently recovering in isolation from Covid-19 or quarantining from being exposed to the virus? Yes, if you take appropriate precautions, the CDC says.
